citation.article-title: Transfer of Defluvibacter lusatiensis to the genus Aquamicrobium as Aquamicrobium lusatiense comb. nov. and description of Aquamicrobium aerolatum sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Aquamicrobium aerolatum sp. nov.
Aquamicrobium aerolatum (ae.ro.la′tum. Gr. n. aer air; L. part. adj. latus -a -um carried; N.L. neut. part. adj. aerolatum airborne).
Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, rod-shaped and motile, 0.3–0.5 μm long and 1.5–2 μm wide.
Good growth after 48 h on nutrient agar and TSA.
Colonies on nutrient agar are smooth, greyish white, translucent and shiny with entire edges.
The type strain is unable to grow at 5 or 2 °C.
Growth occurs at pH 5.5–10 and 0.9–7 % NaCl (w/v).
The detailed fatty acid profile is given in Table 1.
The type strain is not able to utilize carbohydrates, organic acids or amino acids under the conditions tested.
Positive results for tests for alkaline phosphatase and l-alanine aminopeptidase activities.
The type strain is Sa14T (=CCUG 57044T =DSM 21857T), isolated from air sampled in a duck shed.
